headline: Broiled Scallops
description: These broiled scallops are flavored with butter, lemon, and garlic salt, then quickly broiled until golden brown and sweet for a quick, easy dinner.

video.description: See how to make Broiled Scallops.
video.name: Broiled Scallops

name: Broiled Scallops
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons melted butter, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the broiler to high heat.
Rinse scallops and place in a shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons melted butter, lemon juice, and garlic salt.
Broil in the preheated broiler until scallops begin to turn golden, 6 to 8 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve with extra melted butter on the side for dipping.

review.reviewBody: Turned out absolutely delicious.
Simple, simple, simple. My husband the newbie in the kitchen followed this - using real garlic with salt and pepper instead of garlic salt - and made a great dish. Better than a restaurant!
Love it. I used only garlic powder instead of garlic salt and sprinkled paprika on top

This is a simple, quick and delicious recipe. The scallops were cooked perfectly at 8 min under the broiler. I made 1-1/2 times the sauce so I could have some remaining to pour over the rice. I did feel like the sauce could use some more flavor, as the flavors are very simple. May experiment by adding black pepper, oregano and or dill.
I made it but pan fried them instead of broiling them.
This was so easy! But, I melted the butter with 2 cloves of fresh minced garlic before pouring into the scallops. Some fresh ground black pepper, a very small amount of salt and there you go!
It turned out great!! Will make it again!!
Defrosted 1# scallops and broiled it. Too much water retained so I think it watered down seasoning.
I followed the recipe as-is, and it was underwhelming. It certainly did not compare to some of the fantastic scallops I’ve had in restaurants.
Have made this a number of times. True to word - restaurant worthy
Yummy and so satisfying! Easy!
Followed the recipe to the tee & it was great!! Didn’t have Parmesan cheese on hand, but used shredded sharp cheddar and it was delicious! I LOVE THIS APP!!!!

This must be the simplest dish with the biggest payoff. Gourmet “fast food.” I only had a pound of scallops, so I added a half pound of shrimp and I would do it again for more interest. Perhaps even add a few clams for accent. And why only 2 tablespoons of butter? Add more! Why not use some real pressed garlic instead of garlic salt. It takes no time, and it’s so much better. So I melted the salted butter, garlic, lemon juice, and some red pepper flakes in a little pot, poured over seafood and mixed it throughout; I arranged seafood in individual gratin dishes, put the lightest sprinkle of fine Italian breadcrumbs over it. Comes out bubbling hot, goes from oven right to the table. I added fresh parsley at the end and a little cup of melted butter on each plate. A great company dish but simple enough for any day of the week. A keeper.

Omit the garlic salt, especially if you are using salted butter. It ruined our meal. The scallops were cooked perfectly, however we had to throw most of them away, because of the salt. Next time I’ll replace the garlic salt with crushed or minced garlic.
The scallops where very flavorful, I did use a large clove of garlic instead of the garlic salt. I also soaked them in the sauce for about an hour before broiling.
I was a little nervous about making this recipe. But it turned out great. The only thing I did was at the end I had to strain scallops before serving. I will definitely make this again
It's good and very simple, but I did substitute garlic powder for the garlic salt, added paprika, and then fresh parsley after they broiled.
Turned out perfect!
I have made this several times
I have made this several times
I highly recommend this. Super easy and good. I served this with cheese filled ravioli tossed in a garlic, onion, fresh tomato, basil, and olive oil sauce. Will definitely make again!

Used 1 Tbsp. garlic powder instead of garlic salt, added 1/2 tsp sea salt, used unsalted butter and Sprinkled with paprika and Parmesan cheese before broiling. 

Didn't need extra butter for dipping.
Delicious!! I will make my scallops this way from now on!!

WOW!! We did this tonight after an extremely stressful work day. Great meal. Easy to prepare - hardest part was thawing the scallops. Made a green salad and zucchini to go with. Makes it easy to be healthy even on the not so great days.
We will definitely make this again and again. Thanks Gail for a recipe that hits all the marks.

I was using sea scallops. I adapted the recipe
 Brushed them with olive oil infused with lemon, salt and Turkish pepper. They came out really well. No butter needed.

Simple, tasty. Others have said it but I'll concur - melt the butter, add lemon juice and brush over scallops first. Also prefer garlic powder to garlic salt. So easy and if you're scallops are fresh, even better - doesn't over power.
Perfect, except the broiling made my smoke detector go off but the scallops were divine!
I cooked it with rice and Chinese vegetables this evening. It was simple, quick and delicious.
Tastey but I prefer Sea Scallops as they are much bigger. I also prefer the frying pan as under the broiler it seemed there was a lot of steam pouring out of the oven.
Easy and delicious!!
It turned out so so goood. I’ll have to prepare them again, hubby insisted

I can't have butter, so I changed it to a drop olive canola oil. I put it on top of fettuccine alfredo. I don't usually like cooking, but this was so easy and really yummy!!!
These came out great! Followed exact directions except cut back on the garlic by half. My husband and I loved how these tasted! Yum!
Delicious and easy
NO changes and will make it again. Time cooking on each side is critical.

I had never made scallops before,,, I was a bit intimidated. I went to Allrecipes and I found this delicious recipe! I’m sorry I only regret not taking a picture of my delicious results! My husband loved it! This will stay in my recipe box!
Will definitely make again. I melted the butter in a small cast iron skillet, mixed in the other ingredients, spooned over the scallops and put the pan in he broiler while I cooked corn on the cob.

Delicious! Living in Maryland, I took notice that another reviewer substituted Old Bay Seasoning for the Garlic Salt. I microwaved 4T butter, 4 sliced garlic cloves and 1oz lime juice, then let it stand while I rinsed and patted dry 1.5lb of Sea Scallops. I brushed a large fry pan and the scallops with the butter mixture, put the scallops in the pan and dusted them with Old Bay. I saluted them 4-5 minutes on a side at medium to medium-high until golden brown. They were great!
These are truly awesome. I make them using only this recipe now.
so easy and delicious!
I have made it many times and added different seasonings. It takes my oven longer to cook the scallops to perfection. Everytime it came out absolutely delicious.

When paired with a vegetable, this is a quick easy meal, which is what I am usually in the market for with my hectic schedule. I normally steam asparagus or some other vegetable right in the store brought bag it came in, and plate it up with these broiled scallops. These have a subtle, yet "just enough" taste. Just watch your broiler, as broilers tend to normally burn your food if you don't pay close attention. Try it! It's EASY EASY EASY!
I doubled the butter and lemon. Added some minced garlic and sprinkled paprika on top.
Easy and delicious! A real hit! Made it just as written.
I love this recipe, I used chives instead of shallots and juiced 1 whole lemon. My family loved it!

Made no changes very tasty, even though I would use Sea Scallops next time as I prefer them over the small Bay Scallops. I will try again being careful of timing to not overcook. Overall I would do again and will as my wife loved them and she prefers her seafood cooked a bit more.
My bf loved these
This is the easiest recipe and absolutely delicious! I substituted ground garlic for the garlic salt. I just wish I had made twice the recipe!
We loved it. Easy recipe to do. Wouldn’t change anything and it was tasty and grilled to perfection. Definitely would make this again and grilled asparagus goes perfectly with it.
These were delicious!

Recipe is good, as written - but I would never use either powdered garlic or garlic salt! The late James Beard deplored them. Rather than broiling - which can be unreliable, I sautéed fresh minced garlic in my cast iron skillet - heated very hot! - using a combination of butter & olive oil. Remove the garlic before it turns brown, then add the scallops. Cook very quickly, remove to a serving dish, sprinkle with salt, the lemon juice and the pan drippings.
Ahhh easy and DELISH!!!!!!
Wonderful recipe.
These scallops they were a big hit so tender and juicy I will always cooked them this way so easy

Delicious! Be sure to buy dry scallops if you can. If your market only has scallops soaked in water, you can fix them by wrapping in a few layers of paper towels and gently squeezing the water out. A hot broiler is a must and keep the scallops about 2 inches from the flames. You should rotate the pan after a few minutes for even cooking.
They were okay, a little bland. It was a good recipe to use as a base.
I’ve never made scallops before. I made them EXACTLY as written and they were phenomenal. Will become part of regular rotation.

They were ok but cooked before the surface was nicely browned. The recipe doesn't say how many inches from the broiling elements. At 500 degrees, my sea scallops we're done before the tops browned. I prefer pan searing the scallops.
Quick and easy dish.

Super easy, and you can play with different spices.
Broiled for 5 minutes, and the 2 pound tray was empty in less than that.
We had 13 people over, and although 2 lbs looks like a lot at the store, it really wasn't enough after cooking them due to shrinkage.... Just something to think about as your planning.
Also added parsley as a garnish. Tasted great!

I followed the suggestion of one of the reviewers to saute' the scallops in a skillet over med-high heat. It was delicious and I will make it again. Next time I will try infusing the butter with whole garlic cloves and then smashing the clove once it is soft. I think I will like the more subtle flavor with the delicate flavor of scallops.
Really good, simple recipe! I used sea scallop and broiled on high for 17 minutes. Were perfect!
So easy, so delicious! I used a little bit of Cajun jerk seasoning I had in the cabinet.

Phenomenal recipe! Made exactly as written and then made it again with a couple changes which were also incredible: I added a splash of white wine to the butter and pan-seared at the end for the last minute for a nice crust! So easy, and a classic go to for future seafood craving nights!
Best scallops ever.
This was my first time making scallops and it came out delicious! Totally going to make this again!

It was amazingly simple! All we had to do was get the scallops, and we had the rest at home.I recommend to save the extra sauce after the scallops have been broiled and serve it with rice on the side. It is also great with lion fish. These delectable scallops simply are better than any restaurant I've ever been to, and this is a MUST TRY AGAIN dish.
These are frigging amazing. I mixed all the ingredients together then poured over the scallops. Amazing!
Easy and delicious. Will definitely be making this recipe again.
So easy. I tweaked mine a bit by adding some organic shredded coconut to the top. Thumbs up :)

I followed the directions, no substitutions or changes to cooking method. Excellent. Husband likes bland food, however, seafood is the exception. The tastes were blended nicely and the scallops almost melt in your mouth. If they aren't, it's you not the recipe.
These make an easy and quick dinner. Scallops are a treat and we all enjoyed this recipe.
quick easy recipe. delicious

I sprinkled a tablespoon of garlic salt over 1.5 pounds of sea scallops, and then drizzled melted butter and lemon juice over the salted scallops before broiling. The end result was WAY too salty. Next time, I will mix the garlic salt in with the butter and lemon juice.
Everyone loved, loved this recipe!!! will make this again and again
Absolutely delicious, quick and super-easy to prepare! This will definitely be my go-to scallop recipe!

Finally a scallop recipe we love. Short simple and to the point. Great as is or topped with a light scampi or even hollandaise sauce. I use pretty much every recipe as a base and experiment until I make recipes my own!
Perfect!
I make this almost every week!
Fried in a pan and was perfect. Served witha salad for a light meal
Easy, yummy, added shrimp too--not all my family loves scallops. Will be making it again!
My family loved this. I made no changes to the ingredients. However I did melt the butter with the seasonings and brush it on them before I broiled them. Very good and VERY easy.

I followed some recommendations of others that had already made this dish by cutting the garlic salt and also using garlic powder along with black pepper. I used sea scallops, mixed the butter with the lemon juice, drizzled the scallops with the butter and lemon mixture and broiled 10 minutes. I rotated the pan about three times during the cooking process for even browning. After plating scallops, I drizzled them with melted butter. Absolutely delicious. This will be my go to scallop recipe because it is so simple and quick.
Great recipe! I followed this recipe exactly, and it was delicious! I'll make this one again!

The first time I made this recipe I used scallops. It was the best scallop recipe. But the second time I made it, I decided to use flounder. I used this same recipe on two flounder fillets and added a little more lemon juice to each and broiled them for 6 minutes. It was an amazing meal and definitely restaurant quality.
The only problem with this recipe is making enough! The bigger the scallops I find the better, I made it with real diced garlic rather then garlic salt....MMMMMM! I can't wait to make it again!
Awesomeness
Excellent. Came out perfect. Can't go wrong with butter and garlic! I used a tsp of minced garlic and a sprinkle of salt instead of garlic salt.

Great. Will make again . Thanks for the help.

PS add the pan drippings to the rice pilaf. Amazing. Thanks for posting.
